alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 7:04PM MST until August 26 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE ANTELOPE CREEK BASIN BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 700 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have moved out of the area. However, runoff from earlier heavy rainfall is still making its way down the Antelope Canyon drainage. Expect water levels to increase over the next few hours in Antelope Canyon. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Antelope Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Antelope Creek basin. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Page, Antelope Creek Basin, LeChee, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Big Five, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Antelope Canyon, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Peach Wash, Sand Wash and Antelope Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Antelope Creek basin. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.
